Document.p: Schools use jobs and goods to produce technology in a similar way to universities. They use many less jobs and goods than universities, but produce far fewer tech points. Given the choice of putting 4 or five schools in a given area, or a university, it is often (but not always) better to put a university in.
Schools do not need to connect to transport, but do need to be within range of a market than can supply the quantity of jobs and goods to make the school work.
Schools cost money to run. You can see the total cost for the last year by clicking on the money button. The value 'scl' is the school cost.
You can see when a blacksmith is working in the usual way, by clicking on it, and every so often the animation will come to life.
